newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Corporate trouble woes to keep Seoul stocks weak.
newsitem.headline: Corporate trouble woes to keep Seoul stocks weak.

text.p: South Korean stocks are forecast to remain weak on Thursday on worries about corporate financial troubles sparked by Yu Sung Co's insolvency, brokers said.
Brokers saw the market rebounding early in the day in response to the past three consecutive days of drops, but said overall market sentiment would remain bearish.

Textile maker Yu Sung on Tuesday filed for court receivership after defaulting on debt payments. Affiliates of the Hansol Group, hit by a negative newspaper report on Wednesday, are expected to fall further. The composite index fell 1.78 percent, or 12.47 points, to 689.10 on Wednesday.
